title.rendered: Explore Job Roles: Physicians and Surgeons

content.rendered:
What are Physicians and Surgeons?

Physicians and Surgeons are medical professionals that diagnose and treat injuries and illnesses.

Where do Physicians and Surgeons work?

  • Hospitals
  • Clinics
  • Healthcare organizations

How much do Physicians and Surgeons make?

Based on real new grad salaries reported through Handshake, the median annual salary for Physicians and Surgeons is $113,000.

What majors are typically interested in becoming Physicians and Surgeons?

One’s major doesn’t necessarily determine their career, but these are some common majors of those who end up pursuing this career path.

  • Pre-med majors
  • Biology majors
  • Chemistry majors
Search Physician/Surgeon jobs on Handshake

Physician and Surgeon skills and competencies:

On top of a relevant degree and formal training, here are some professional skills that can help aspiring Physicians and Surgeons succeed in their work:

  • High attention to detail
  • Great communication skills
  • For surgeons, strong motor skills are highly valued

What are some common questions about Physicians and Surgeons?

Q: What’s the difference between a Surgeon and a Physician?

A: Both diagnose illnesses and implement treatment on their patients. The main difference is that all Surgeons perform surgery on their patients, but not all Physicians can.
